â€œSimon is an autistic nonverbal savant in free diving and in-water mediationâ€ says Juan Chavez, the father of Simon (@autistic_soul_diver), who was diagnosed at age 3 with autism, and began swimming lessons when he was 12. â€œWe observed how he spent hours and hours floating in the water without effort and controlling his buoyancy,â€ Juan says. â€œWe decided to take him to the oceanâ€¦ it was like his natural environment. â€œI try to emulate something organic and free-forming,â€ says artist Dan Lam (@sopopomo), who works with polyurethane foam, acrylic paint and resin to create colorful, visually vibrating, solid sculptural creations that capture a very fluid look. â€œI enjoy the process of guiding a material but letting it take its own form and letting gravity do its work,â€ she says. â€œThis allows accidents and mistakes to happen, which is where the fun and play is.â€â£

â€œHeath focuses on making classics â€” not making trends,â€ says Robin Bailey, co-owner of Heath Ceramics (@heathceramics), based in Sausalito, California. Originally founded in 1948 by ceramicist Edith Heath, Robin and his wife Cathy bought the company in 2003. â€œIt was a time when manufacturing was really going away, and it was exciting to put a stake in the ground and say weâ€™re going to keep up this amazing legacy and craftsmanship here,â€ Robin says.â£

â€œThese ghosts are playful, tender and nostalgic,â€ says Angela Deane (@angeladeane), who transforms vintage, found family photographs by painting semi-translucent ghosts over existing figures. â€œThereâ€™s something profoundly delightful in how simple and evocative these pieces are. Haus of horror. â€œHalloween is a time of embracing all things different, embracing free expression, creativity, festivity and a lack of seriousness that I like to showcase in my life and art every day,â€ says Kane Lee (@fakehauswives).â£

â€œMy artwork is made up of semi-realistic cartoonish characters that I imagine live in their own world,â€ says the 17-year-old artist, who was inspired to create these pieces by the makeup art of @madroni_redclock and @zah. â€œBy each character taking on their own individual traits, I think it gives the viewer the ability to imagine a setting each character would belong in.â€â£
